p:
The most representative volatile constituents of S. hydrangea essential oils were oxygenated sesquiterpenes (28.58% in leaf oil and 48.33% in flower oil), in accordance with previous results
39 . Oxygenated monoterpenes were also present but in lower amounts (27.81% in leaf oil and 16.38% in flower oil), but these results were not in agreement with those obtained by Kotan et al.
30 , who detected a higher amount of these compounds. These differences may be related to the timing of plant collection and the ecological conditions
38 .
